title: Beauty Queen, 23, puts bad luck with men down to the way she looks
text:
Get the biggest daily news stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

A beauty queen has put her bad luck with men down to the way she looks as she continues her quest for love.

Joey Staerkle, from Llandudno, has won several titles at beauty pageants across Wales over the past few years.

But the 23-year-old believes her looks may have prevented her finding love - because she attracts the wrong guys.

The beauty queen has now ditched the glamour of the beauty world for a new TV show which sees girls banned from wearing make-up go on a series of blind dates.

The objective being to find a relationship based on attraction that is more than skin deep, reports North Wales Live .

(Image: Joey Staerkle)

(Image: Joey Staerkle)

Joey won Miss Supranational Wales 2016 and was also crowned Miss Conwy Galaxy, as well as being named Miss Popularity at the Miss Galaxy Wales beauty pageant.

She has also just graduated with a First Class Honors Degree in business from Chester University.

She appears in the upcoming BBC Wales series called Beauty Queen and Single alongside five other girls with beauty pageant experience.

Joey said: "I did get a bit emotional with not being allowed to wear make-up for the dates, as I would always wear make-up even if it's just mascara and concealer.

(Image: Joey Staerkle)

"Make-up is like a protection, especially as a beauty queen I try and look as perfect as I can."

She added: "But what I've learnt through doing the show is that I felt more confidence by the end of it that you don't have to look picture perfect all the time."

Joey who is of Swiss and English descent, wouldn't be drawn on whether she met her dream man through the show.

When asked why she hasn't yet met her Prince Charming, she said: "I just seem to attract the wrong guys every single time.

"I think because of the certain way I look I get the more cocky boys the ones who are really into themselves and the nice boys might feel a bit too intimidated - all I want is someone who is kind, family orientated and career focused.

(Image: Daily Post Wales)

"One example of one of my dating nightmares was when I was dating a guy in London whose 'girlfriend' wanted to hit me but luckily somebody stopped her, it turns out he wasn't single at all."

When asked if beauty pageants are still relevant in this day and age, Joey replied: "It's not just based on your looks, it's also about how well you do in your interview and what charity work you do - it's not always the best looking person who wins.

"But I do want to move on from them as I've received a lot of negative comments on social media especially during the international competitions, people saying I'm too fat and so on - there's so much pressure on women thanks to social media and I try and stay away from it all."

Joey says she is now giving up beauty pageants to concentrate on becoming a professional singer, and would also like to become a property developer.
description: Joey Staerkle, from North Wales, is appearing in a new BBC Wales series called Beauty Queen and Single in her quest for love
